Description:
Site Assessment:Conduct comprehensive site assessments to evaluate the extent and nature of soil and groundwater contamination.
Collect and analyze soil and water samples, and interpret data to determine contamination levels.Remediation Planning:Develop tailored remediation plans based on site conditions, contaminant types, and regulatory requirements.
Select appropriate remediation technologies and methods, such as excavation, bioremediation, chemical treatment, or others.Regulatory Compliance:Ensure compliance with environmental regulations, permitting, and reporting requirements throughout the remediation process.
Collaborate with regulatory agencies to obtain necessary approvals and adhere to standards.Engineering Design:Create detailed engineering designs for remediation systems, including soil vapor extraction, groundwater pumping, and containment systems.
Incorporate engineering principles to optimize system efficiency and performance.Skills
Skills:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, preferred Mechanical background.
Professional Engineer (PE) license is a plus.
Good experience in soil washing plant.
Proactive, logical approach to diagnosis of plant faults and their rectification.
Working as a member of the operations team to constantly strive for continuous improvements through improving processes and product development.
